cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on enhancing information retrieval performance by combining ontological features with keywords. This is a common topic in the field of Information Retrieval (IR), which falls under the Computer Science (CS) category. The use of named entities and ontologies is also related to Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computational Linguistics (CL), which are sub-categories of CS. Therefore, cs.IR and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories. 

The paper also proposes different adaptations of the Vector Space Model, which is a common technique in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), both of which are sub-categories of CS. Additionally, the use of ontologies and named entities can be related to Database Systems (DB), which is another sub-category of CS. Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed models, which can be related to Learning (LG) and Performance Evaluation (PE), both of which are sub-categories of CS. 

Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IR and cs.CL, followed by cs.AI, cs.DB, and cs.LG.
